JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 5TH DAY OF JANUARY 2015/15TH POUSHA, 1936 Cri.MC.No. 7064 of 2014 () CC.NO. 408/2014 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, PATTAMBI CRIME NO. 508/2013 OF PATTAMBI POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD PETITIONERS/ACCUSED : 1. RAJEEV C., 28 YEARS S/O. SIVARAMAN NAIR, AZHAKATH HOUSE, CHOORAKODE VALLAPUZHA POST. 2. DEVAYANI, 63 YEARS W/O.SIVARAMAN NAIR, AZHAKATH HOUSE, CHOORAKODE VALLAPUZHA POST. BY ADV. SRIL.R.SREEHARI RESPONDENTS/COMPLAINANT AND STATE : 1. SRUTHI, 23 YEARS D/O.RAMADAS C.P., CHITTUVAZHIPUTHAN VEEDU EZHUVANTHALA, NELLAYA POST, PALAKKAD DISTRICT PIN - 679 335. 2. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR HIGH COURT OF KERALA ERNAKULAM THROUGH THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE PATTAMBI POLICE STATION, PATTAMBI - 679 303. Ri BY ADV. SRI.K.RAJESH SUKUMARAN R2 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI. JIBU P. THOMAS THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 05-01-2015, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Mn wdl- qoute BSR 2015/KER/35 Cri.MC.No. 7064 of 2014 () APPENDIX PETITIONERS' ANNEXURES : ANNEXURE A1. CERTIFIED COPY OF COMPLAINT CMP NO.2110/2013 FILED BEFORE JFCM COURT, PATTAMBI. ANNEXURE Az. CERTIFIED COPY OF FIR IN CRIME NO.508/2013 OF PATTAMBI POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A3. CERTIFIED COPY OF FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.508/2013 OF PATTAMBI POLICE STATION FILED BEFORE JFCM COURT, PATTAMBI. ANNEXURE A4. CERTIFIED COPY OF JUDGMENT IN OP NO.217/2014 OF FAMILY COURT, OTTAPALAM DATED 15.10.2014. RESPONDENT(S)' EXHIBITS: NIL HTRUE COPYI/ PA. TO JUDGE Mn an Ble 2015/KER/35 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. vee CTEMAC, NO-7064 Of 2014 Dated this the 5 day of January, 2015 ORDER This is a petition filed under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 2. Petitioners are the accused in Crime No.508/2013 of Pattambi Police Station registered for the offences punishable under Sections 498A and 406 read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 3. Petitioners have come up with this petition for getting Annexure-A3 final report in Crime No.508/2013 of Pattambi Police Station as against the petitioners and all further proceedings based on it in C.C.408/2014 pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Pattambi, quashed. 4. The allegation against the petitioners is that they have tortured and harassed the de facto complainant, who an Ble 2015/KER/35 Crl.M.C.7064/2014 5. is the wife of the 1* petitioner, and treated her with cruelty within the meaning of Section 498A IPC, by demanding more dowry after misappropriating her entire gold ornaments and money. 5. Heard learned counsel for the petitioners, the learned counsel for the defacto complainant, who is the 1* respondent herein, and learned Public Prosecutor. 6. According to the petitioners, all the matters in dispute between the petitioners and the defacto complainant have been amicably settled and presently, the defacto complainant has no complaints against the petitioners and, therefore, the proceedings against the petitioners may be quashed. 7. The defacto complainant, who is the 1* respondent herein, has filed an affidavit affirming that all the matters in dispute between her and the petitioners have been amicably settled and, therefore, she has no complaints against the petitioners and, therefore, all further aa ap 2015/KER/35 Crl.M.C.7064/2014 3: proceedings in the matter referred to above can be quashed. She has entered appearance through her counsel. The learned counsel for the defacto complainant also endorses the fact that the affidavit has been sworn in by the defacto complainant on her own volition. 8. When all the matrimonial disputes have been settled between the parties and as the defacto complainant has no complaints against the petitioners, it is only just and expedient in the interest of justice to quash the proceedings referred to above. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A3 final report in Crime No.508/2013 of Pattambi Police Station as against the petitioners and all further proceedings based on it in C.C.408/2014 pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Pattambi are hereby quashed. Sd/- (B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/05/01
